article.headline: Coronavirus tally: U.S. daily death toll tops 1,000 for 3rd-straight day
article.body: The U.S. daily case tally of the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 increased to 46,029 on Aug. 20, according to New York Times Data, as there were at least 1,042 fatalities, the third-straight day that the death toll topped 1,000. As of Friday morning, the U.S. remained first globally with 5.58 million cases and 174,290 deaths, according to Johns Hopkins University data, has was still third in the world with 1.95 million recovered. Texas was first in new cases with 5,259, followed by California with 4,993 and Florida with 4,555. Outside of the U.S, Brazil is second in both cases and deaths, with 3.50 million cases and 112,304 deaths, according to JHU data. India is third in cases with 2.91 million and Mexico is third in deaths with 59,106. For recoveries, Brazil is first with 2.84 million, while India is second with 2.16 million
